DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Hematocrit Outcome Data Validation Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information related to the results of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for hematocrit, the percentage of a whole blood specimen that is composed of red blood cells (erythrocytes)._A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn._The act of validating; finding or testing the truth of something._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the results of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for hematocrit, the percentage of a whole blood specimen that is composed of red blood cells (erythrocytes).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: A measure of the volume of red blood cells expressed as a percentage of the total blood volume. Normal in males is 43-49%, in females 37-43%.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: A measure of the volume of red blood cells expressed as a percentage of the total blood volume. Normal in males is 43-49%, in females 37-43%.
